intro: Columnea pallida, commonly known as the pale columnea, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are often borne in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and usually have a slightly hairy texture. Columnea pallida is often cultivated as a houseplant or in hanging baskets due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
